item.description:
Windblown is a smallish area with 40 km so we will tour, have lunch in the lodge then tour again, so we can travel light. The lodge is known for their great soups and sandwiches if you want to buy, or you are free to pack a lunch.

The weather is supposed to be quite warm with a high in the mid to high 40's - perfect spring klister conditions for waxers or use your waxless skis.

More info at Windblown's website:http://windblownxc.com

Â 

cheers,

Mike
item.how_to_find_us: Meet outside by the ski racks and waxing shed at about 9:30, I'll be wearing a red swix vest and a black AMC Yellowstone hat.

group.name: The Boston Cross-Country Skiing and Snowshoe Meetup Group

item.name: Spring Skiing at Windblown
